Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:

  red onion
  white onion
  white tuna

Directions:

  roast the red onion
  slice the white tuna
  roast the white tuna
  prepare meal

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
You've entered a kitchen. You can barely contain your excitement.

You can see an opened fridge in the room. The fridge contains an orange bell pepper, a carrot, a yellow onion, some milk and some water. You can see a closed oven. As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a table. On the table you make out a cookbook and a knife. You can make out a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a green hot pepper, a red apple, a raw red potato and a tomato. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best? You see a stove. The stove is conventional. But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of trash.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a fridge. Huh, weird. The fridge contains a raw chicken wing, a block of cheese, a parsley, a cilantro, some water and some milk. As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see an oven. You smell an intriguing smell, and follow it to a table. You see a knife on the table, so there's that. You see a counter. You see a banana, a raw yellow potato and a cookbook on the counter. You can see a stove. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a stove in a room.



There is a red hot pepper on the floor.

messages_raw.feedback: You already have that.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
You've just sauntered into a kitchen.

You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a fridge. The fridge is empty, what a horrible day! You can make out an oven. There's something strange about this being here, but you can't put your finger on it. What's that over there? It looks like it's a table. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? The table is massive. Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though. You can make out a counter. On the counter you make out a cookbook. You scan the room for a stove, and you find a stove. However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

  some water
  a yellow onion
  a green hot pepper
  a red onion
  a raw chicken wing
  a raw chicken leg
  a yellow bell pepper
  a raw red potato
  a yellow apple
  a white onion
messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
You find yourself in a kitchen. An usual kind of place. Okay, just remember what you're here to do, and everything will go great.

You make out an opened conventional looking fridge close by. The fridge contains a raw white tuna, a block of cheese, a cilantro and a parsley. You shudder, but continue examining the room. You can make out a closed oven in the room. You can see a table. However, the table, like an empty table, has nothing on it. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it? You see a counter. Why don't you take a picture of it, it'll last longer! The counter is vast. On the counter you can see a raw purple potato, a red hot pepper, a cookbook and a knife. You smell an awful smell, and follow it to a stove. The stove is conventional. However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it.

messages_raw.feedback:
You open the copy of "Cooking: A Modern Approach (3rd Ed.)" and start reading:

---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  chicken wing
  green hot pepper
  red onion
  water
  yellow onion

Directions:
  fry the chicken wing
  dice the green hot pepper
  chop the red onion
  chop the yellow onion
  prepare meal

You make out an opened conventional looking fridge close by. The fridge contains a raw white tuna, a block of cheese, a cilantro and a parsley. You shudder, but continue examining the room. You can make out a closed oven in the room. You can see a table. However, the table, like an empty table, has nothing on it. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it? You see a counter. Why don't you take a picture of it, it'll last longer! The counter is vast. On the counter you can see a raw purple potato, a red hot pepper, a cookbook and a knife. You smell an awful smell, and follow it to a stove. The stove is conventional. However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it.

You find yourself in a kitchen. An usual kind of place. Okay, just remember what you're here to do, and everything will go great.

You make out an opened conventional looking fridge close by. The fridge contains a raw white tuna, a block of cheese, a cilantro and a parsley. You shudder, but continue examining the room. You can make out a closed oven in the room. You can see a table. However, the table, like an empty table, has nothing on it. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it? You see a counter. Why don't you take a picture of it, it'll last longer! The counter is vast. On the counter you can see a raw purple potato, a red hot pepper, a cookbook and a knife. You smell an awful smell, and follow it to a stove. The stove is conventional. However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it.

messages_raw.feedback: You already have that.
messages_raw.recipe:
Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  chicken wing
  green hot pepper
  red onion
  water
  yellow onion

Directions:
  fry the chicken wing
  dice the green hot pepper
  chop the red onion
  chop the yellow onion
  prepare meal
messages_raw.inventory:
You are carrying:
  some water
  a yellow onion
  a green hot pepper
  a red onion
  a raw chicken wing
  a raw chicken leg
  a yellow bell pepper
  a raw red potato
  a yellow apple
  a white onion

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
You've entered a kitchen.

You can see a fridge. The fridge contains a raw chicken leg and a white onion. You see a closed oven here. You make out a table. The table is massive. Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. You see a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you make out a raw yellow potato, a green hot pepper and a cookbook. You can make out a stove. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

You see a closed fridge. As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see an oven! You can make out a table. The table is massive. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. You scan the room, seeing a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you make out a yellow bell pepper, a red apple, a yellow onion, a raw purple potato and a cookbook. Now that's what I call TextWorld! Look over there! a stove. The stove is conventional. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. This always happens!

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
You've just sauntered into a kitchen. You begin to take stock of what's here.

You can make out a fridge. The fridge is empty! What a waste of a day! You see an oven. You shudder, but continue examining the room. Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a table. The table is massive. On the table you make out a cookbook. You can see a counter. Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though. Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a stove. The stove is conventional. But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of trash. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

This might come as a shock to you, but you've just walked into a kitchen.

You see an open fridge. The fridge is empty! What a waste of a day! What's that over there? It looks like it's an oven. You rest your hand against a wall, but you miss the wall and fall onto a table. The table is massive. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a counter. You see a cookbook on the counter. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best? You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a stove. The stove is conventional. Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Silly stove, silly, empty, good for nothing stove.

messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
This might come as a shock to you, but you've just walked into a kitchen.

You see an open fridge. The fridge is empty! What a waste of a day! What's that over there? It looks like it's an oven. You rest your hand against a wall, but you miss the wall and fall onto a table. The table is massive. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a counter. You see a cookbook on the counter. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best? You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a stove. The stove is conventional. Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Silly stove, silly, empty, good for nothing stove.

messages_raw.feedback: You already have that.

The table is massive. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a counter. But the thing is empty. You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a stove. The stove is conventional. Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Silly stove, silly, empty, good for nothing stove.

Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  white onion
  yellow apple

Directions:
  slice the yellow apple
  prepare meal
messages_raw.inventory:
You are carrying:
  a cookbook
  a sliced yellow apple
  a white onion
  a raw white tuna
  a yellow onion
  a raw yellow potato
  a red apple
messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
This might come as a shock to you, but you've just walked into a kitchen.

You see an open fridge. The fridge is empty! What a waste of a day! What's that over there? It looks like it's an oven. You rest your hand against a wall, but you miss the wall and fall onto a table. The table is massive. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a counter. But the thing is empty. You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a stove. The stove is conventional. Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Silly stove, silly, empty, good for nothing stove.

messages_raw.feedback: You already have that.
